hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util

Class DefaultObserverEx<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.DefaultObserver<T>
      • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.DefaultObserverEx<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the element type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseObserver, Observer<T>, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Zip.ManyObservables.ItemObserver

    public abstract class DefaultObserverEx<T>
extends DefaultObserver<T>
    Extension to the default observer for cases when the observer itself needs to track sub-observers and their close handlers.

    Note when overriding onClose, you should always call super.onClose() to close any remaining subObservers.

    Author:
    akarnokd, 2011.02.11.

      void add(Object token, Closeable handler)
      Adds or replaces a new closeable with a token to the sub-observer list.
      protected void init()
      Implementations might override this method to initialize some other resources outside the onRegister's lock, before onRegister.
      protected void onClose()
      Called by close to close down any associated resources with this instance.
      protected void onRegister()
      Called internally with the global lock held to ensure any dependent registrations succeed to store the closeable reference before returning.
      Closeable registerWith(Observable<? extends T> source)
      While holding the global lock, executes the onRegister method then registers this instance with the supplied source observable with the this token.
      void remove(Object token)
      Removes and closes the close handler associated with the token.
      static <T> DefaultObserverEx<T> wrap(Observer<? super T> observer)
      Wraps the supplied observer into a DefaultObservableEx and simply forwards onNext, onError, onFinish events to the raw next, error and finish methods.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultObserverEx

        public DefaultObserverEx()
        Constructor. Sets up the observer to complete once the error or finish messages are received.

      • DefaultObserverEx

        public DefaultObserverEx(boolean complete)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        complete - should the observer close its sub-resources automatically on error/finish?

                 Lock lock,
                 boolean complete)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Object token,
       Closeable handler)
        Adds or replaces a new closeable with a token to the sub-observer list. If this observer is already in completed state, the handler is closed immediately.
        Parameters:
        token - the reference token
        handler - the closeable handler

      • onRegister

        protected void onRegister()
        Called internally with the global lock held to ensure any dependent registrations succeed to store the closeable reference before returning.

      • registerWith

        @Nonnull
public Closeable registerWith(@Nonnull
                             Observable<? extends T> source)
        While holding the global lock, executes the onRegister method then registers this instance with the supplied source observable with the this token. If the this token is already registered, the previous handle is closed.
        Parameters:
        source - the source observable
        Returns:
        this

      • remove

        public void remove(@Nonnull
          Object token)
        Removes and closes the close handler associated with the token.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to the closeable handler

      • onClose

        protected void onClose()
        Description copied from class: DefaultObserver
        Called by close to close down any associated resources with this instance.

        The close() method ensures that the lock is held this code executes.

        Overrides:
        onClose in class DefaultObserver<T>

      • wrap

        public static <T> DefaultObserverEx<T> wrap(@Nonnull
                            Observer<? super T> observer)
        Wraps the supplied observer into a DefaultObservableEx and simply forwards onNext, onError, onFinish events to the raw next, error and finish methods.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the observed element type
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to wrap
        Returns:
        the wrapper default observer ex

      • init

        protected void init()
        Implementations might override this method to initialize some other resources outside the onRegister's lock, before onRegister.
